intro: Syzygium guineense subsp. afromontana, commonly known as the African montane guineense, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the highland regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its elliptical, glossy leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces edible berries that are often used in traditional medicine and local cuisine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is adapted to cool, humid climates. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable in some regions.
